B

beginTransaction(Database, TransactionDefinition) - Method in interface org.castor.spring.orm.dialect.CastorDialect
Begin a transaction with the given Castor JDO Database, applying the semantics specified by the given Spring transaction definition (in particular, an isolation level and a timeout).
beginTransaction(Database, TransactionDefinition) - Method in class org.castor.spring.orm.dialect.DefaultCastorDialect
This implementation invokes the standard Castor JDO Database.begin() method.

C

CastorAccessor - Class in org.castor.spring.orm
Base class for CastorTemplate and CastorInterceptor, defining common properties like JDOManager and flushing behavior.
CastorAccessor() - Constructor for class org.castor.spring.orm.CastorAccessor
 
CastorCallback - Interface in org.castor.spring.orm
Callback interface for Castor JDO code.
CastorDaoSupport - Class in org.castor.spring.orm.support
Convenient super class for Castor JDO data access objects.
CastorDaoSupport() - Constructor for class org.castor.spring.orm.support.CastorDaoSupport
 
CastorDialect - Interface in org.castor.spring.orm.dialect
SPI strategy that encapsulates certain functionality that Castor JDO does not offer despite being relevant in the context of O/R mapping, like access to the underlying JDBC Connection and explicit flushing of changes to the database.
CastorInterceptor - Class in org.castor.spring.orm
This interceptor binds a new JDO Database to the thread before a method, closing and removing it afterwards in case of any method outcome.
CastorInterceptor() - Constructor for class org.castor.spring.orm.CastorInterceptor

CastorSystemException - Exception in org.castor.spring.orm
JDO-specific subclass of UncategorizedDataAccessException, for JDO system errors that do not match any concrete org.springframework.dao exceptions.
CastorSystemException(PersistenceException) - Constructor for exception org.castor.spring.orm.CastorSystemException
 
CastorTemplate - Class in org.castor.spring.orm
Helper class that simplifies Castor JDO data access code, and converts PersistenceExceptions into Spring DataAccessExceptions, following the org.springframework.dao exception hierarchy.

flush(Database) - Method in interface org.castor.spring.orm.dialect.CastorDialect
Flush the given Castor JDO Database, i.e. flush all changes (that have been applied to persistent objects) to the underlying database.
flush(Database) - Method in class org.castor.spring.orm.dialect.DefaultCastorDialect
This implementation throws a general Castor JDO PersistenceException to signal that eager flushing is not supported.

This implementation delegates to JDOManagerUtils.
